text.section: A police officer may issue a citation to a person who the police officer has probable cause to believe has committed a violation under this part.

section.section: A violation under this part is a civil offense.

Adjudication of a violation under this part:
is not a criminal conviction for any purpose; and
does not impose any of the civil disabilities that may result from a criminal conviction.

text.section: The form of the citation shall be uniform throughout the State and shall be prescribed by the District Court.
The Chief Judge of the District Court shall establish a schedule for the prepayment of a fine.

section.section: The law enforcement agency of the police officer who issued the citation shall forward to the District Court having venue a copy of the citation and a request for trial.
The District Court shall promptly schedule the case for trial and summon the defendant to appear.

text.section: If a person is found to have committed a violation under this part, the person is subject to a fine not exceeding $25.
The court costs for a violation under this part are $5.
